author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Oregon cop in take down of Chris Harper Mercer identified
text:
Myspace Chris Harper Mercer, 26, was identified as the man who opened fire at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore. Minutes after the massacre at Umpqua Community College began Thursday morning, Sgt. Joe Kaney with Roseburg Police rushed into the chaos.
He and a fellow officer were able to engage the shooter and take him out, a family friend told the Daily News.
Reached at his home Thursday night, Kaney, 49, declined to comment or even confirm his involvement, but his wife beamed with pride.
OREGON SHOOTER WAS AN 'ANGRY YOUNG MAN WHO WAS VERY FILLED WITH HATE': REPORT
"Well of course he's a hero, yeah," his wife Dayna Kaney told The News.
STEVE DIPAOLA/REUTERS Umpqua Community College alumnus Donice Smith (left) is embraced after she said one of her former teachers was shot dead, near the site of a mass shooting at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore. October 1, 2015. Michael Sullivan/The News-Review via Reuters First responders transport an injured person following a shooting incident at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore. October 1, 2015. Michael Sullivan/The News-Review via AP A bullet casing is marked at the scene of a deadly shooting at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Ore., Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015. Michael Sullivan/The News-Review via Reuters Police officers inspect bags as students and staff are evacuated from campus following a shooting incident at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg, Oregon October 1, 2015. Previous Next Enlarge Dayna said she was "happy" he was able to respond in a way that likely saved lives and then return home safe.
The friend said Kaney and his wife watched a movie together Thursday night to try and take his mind off the traumatic and heartbreaking day.
10 DEAD, 7 INJURED AFTER SHOOTING AT UMPQUA COMMUNITY COLLEGE IN OREGON
"We know that we have at least two heroic officers who exchanged gunfire with the suspect," Douglas County Sheriff John Hanlin said at an emotional evening press conference during which he vowed to never utter the shooter's name.
View Gallery Scenes of chaos follow deadly shooting at Umpqua Community College in Oregon Earlier in the day he told reporters that officers engaged the suspect in an “exchange of gunfire” that “neutralized” the threat.
Kaney commands his department's Criminal Investigations Division, according to the City of Roseburg website.
He reportedly was shot in the line of duty back in 2005 and later wrote the department's body camera policy.
It's not clear if he was wearing a camera during the campus rampage that ended Thursday with at least 10 dead.
Nancy Dillon is reporting from Roseburg, Oregon.
